Klaatu.Action: Raises arms in universal gesture of neutrality and states 'We have come to visit you in peace -- and with good will.'
Advances slowly toward soldiers holding a strange object in a gesture of offering, despite soldiers' fear and suspicion.
Raises an object toward the platoon leader trying to make clear his intentions, indicating non-hostile approach.
Is shot by soldiers who misinterpret his gesture as menacing but does not respond aggressively.
Instructs Gort to spare the tank commander’s life despite the attack on him.
Picks up the broken gift intended for the President and reflects ruefully on its destruction, showing regret and sincerity.
Despite being wounded and in considerable pain, he maintains great dignity and calmly interacts with military officers, showing composure and control.
Raises himself to his feet painfully and accepts medical help without resistance, demonstrating practical awareness of his physical limits and the situation.
Drops the broken telescope with a shrug of mild exasperation after explaining its purpose, indicating a somewhat resigned or understated reaction rather than panic or confusion.
Maintains inner dignity and assurance despite injury, allowing a White House official to see him promptly.
Maintains calm and assurance despite being injured and confined to a hospital bed; projects inner dignity and authority.
Does not reveal his origin or information despite being questioned and under scrutiny.
Addresses Harley calmly and politely, invites him to sit down to ease tension.
Speaks coolly and reservedly, maintaining a certain emotional distance throughout the exchange.
Engages in conversation with Harley using straightforward honesty about his origins and travel, without condescension.
Wants to meet representatives from all nations of Earth rather than just personally with one individual, emphasizing concern for all people on the planet.
Calmly and politely corrects Harley about the scope of the situation and maintains a measured tone.
Smiles when joking about early television impressions, showing a friendly and good-natured side.
Dismisses internal affairs as not his concern, indicating a distancing or tolerance of Earth's political conflicts.
Responds somewhat sharply when corrected about discussing the matter personally, showing limited tolerance for misunderstanding.
Stares thoughtfully and tolerantly at the confusing human world, showing reflective understanding rather than rash judgment.
Made a respectful, polite impression on the medical officers, gently humored their disbelief about his age and knowledge, being nice about it.
Chose not to boast despite his advanced knowledge and long lifespan, instead treated others with humility and kindness.
He applies an advanced salve that completely heals a bullet wound overnight.
Maintains a calm and confident demeanor when explaining his abilities, making others feel intellectually inferior yet treated politely.
Appears fully recovered and walks confidently in the hospital room after injury.
Listens calmly and politely to bad diplomatic news without visible frustration or panic.
Ignores the sheaf of cables with important diplomatic replies presented to him.
Refuses to speak to any one nation or group of nations, criticizing childish jealousies and suspicions.
Shows mounting indignation at mistrust and suspicion among humans, highlighting his frustration with their behavior rather than personal animosity.
Judges humanity sternly but not personally hostile; focuses on general human failings (stupidity, suspicions).
Ignores official cables and diplomatic naysaying, demonstrating focus on larger picture rather than bureaucratic obstacles.
Refuses to engage with individual nations or participate in their political jealousies and suspicions, showing principled and strategic thinking.
Sharp and impatient with perceived stupidity, indicating confidence and expectation of rationality.
Looks thoughtfully out the window, seemingly formulating a plan based on observation rather than reacting emotionally.
Expresses desire to understand Earth's people by getting out among them despite being a prisoner.
Smiles with tolerant amusement upon realizing he is locked in.
Escapes from the hospital unnoticed, evading military guards and causing widespread alarm.
Pauses thoughtfully under a street lamp, hesitates, then carries suitcase into a boarding house.
Stands calmly in the doorway unthreateningly despite tense atmosphere
Does not react to the fearful or tense responses of the people in the room
Stands calmly and motionless in the doorway despite the tense atmosphere and shocked silence around him.
Introduces himself politely as 'Carpenter' and calmly responds to questions without suspicion or arrogance.
Follows Mrs. Crockett to the room without complaint or assertiveness, indicating respectfulness.
Assumes the identity 'Carpenter' and calmly requests a room, adapting to the situation to avoid suspicion.
Responds truthfully yet carefully to questions (e.g. not an FBI man), maintaining a composed demeanor.
Allows tension to ease and does not escalate conflict or suspicion despite being studied and questioned.
Exchanges a polite smile with Helen.
Exchanges a polite smile with Helen, calmly engages with Mrs. Crockett who correctly discerns his New England accent.
Sits quietly and listens during breakfast with the boarders, appearing thoughtful and not distracted by the tense atmosphere.
Shows affronted dignity at the idea of being hunted and compared to a monster.
Reads news about scientists being mobilized to study the spaceship with thoughtful interest and reacts with dignified offense to sensationalist and unreasonable radio commentary.
Gently advises Helen to learn more about people before judging them, showing patience and a helpful attitude.
Responds quietly and with wit to Mrs. Barley’s sharp remark, indicating tolerance rather than hostility.
Advises Helen to learn about the people to better orient herself in a strange environment, showing awareness and thoughtful consideration.
Responds quietly and with subtle humor to Mrs. Barley's dismissive remark about Washington not being strange, demonstrating calm confidence and poise.
Offers to spend the day with Bobby to help Helen and Tom
Pauses thoughtfully and admits to being confused, showing self-awareness and humility.
Offers to take care of Bobby without being asked, demonstrating initiative and social awareness.
Expresses admiration for Abraham Lincoln and reflects thoughtfully on great men and thinkers, engaging sincerely with Bobby's answers.
Shows patient interest in Bobby's thoughts and gently corrects misunderstandings without condescension.
Watches the men at work with mild, quiet amusement.
Responds to Bobby's excitement with a quizzical smile and informative answers.
Observes the men at work with mild, quiet amusement, showing calm assessment.
Answers Bobby's curious questions about the ship's power source accurately and confidently (atomic power, not only for bombs).
Maintains composure and is thoughtful in conversation rather than showing overt excitement.
Patiently explains complex scientific concepts to a child, lowers his voice to avoid embarrassing others listening in, and gently leads the child away from a potentially embarrassing situation.
Skillfully explains complex technical details about speed and landing to a child in a way that is believable and easy to understand.
Notices the two men eavesdropping, adjusts his tone and content to avoid over-explaining and revealing too much, demonstrating situational awareness.
Leads the child away calmly and confidently after the interruption and awkward social interaction, maintaining control of the situation.
Smiles apologetically at Bobby when his explanation is not understood.
Invites Bobby to meet Professor Barnhardt in a playful, friendly way.
Shares a private smile and friendly banter with Bobby.
Responds to Bobby's question about being found with a calm and confident doubt.
Gives a technically accurate but overly complex explanation of velocity that Bobby does not understand.
Acknowledges Bobby’s confusion and smiles apologetically, showing social awareness and humility.
Suggests a plan to visit Professor Barnhardt to understand how he talks, showing initiative and thoughtful problem-solving.
Engages in playful banter with Bobby, demonstrating confidence and ease.
Joins Bobby in looking for Barnhardt, responds to Bobby's curiosity by engaging with the environment and studying the blackboard with great interest and curiosity.
Shakes his head smiling, gently correcting Bobby's misconception about the problem on the blackboard, showing patience and kindness.
Opens locked door without hesitation and smiles with secret amusement, inviting Bobby along to explore.
Pleasantly reassures Hilda after she reprimands him for writing on the blackboard, showing calm and easy assurance.
Respectfully gives Hilda a note for Professor Barnhardt before leaving as she asks them to leave.
Writes confidently on the blackboard, correctly differentiates an equation to assist Professor Barnhardt.
Handles confrontation with Hilda calmly and confidently, uses a polite but assured manner to explain his purpose and leaves a contact note.
Unruffled by Hilda's stern questioning and remains in control of the situation without panic or confusion.
Tells Hilda not to erase the professor's corrections because the professor needs them badly.
Talks and laughs with Bobby as they walk together, showing a friendly interaction.
Shows childlike curiosity and playfulness by attempting to play hopscotch with kids on the sidewalk.

Glances understandingly at Bobby when he mentions his father, shows sadness at the rows of graves, engages in reflective conversation about war and peace, and gently shifts topics to maintain Bobby's comfort.
Understands the gravity of war and reflects thoughtfully on the significance of Arlington Cemetery, showing emotional intelligence and situational awareness.
Admits unfamiliarity with Earthly customs and history, indicating a gap in relevant knowledge while interacting with Bobby.
Offers to take Bobby to the movies and gives him valuable diamonds in exchange for Bobby's money.
Uses diamonds as currency to cleverly and confidently negotiate and interact with Bobby.
Hesitates momentarily before asking about money for the movies.
Reads to Bobby, who is perched happily on the arm of Klaatu's chair.
Responds with mild curiosity and a smile of satisfaction when recognized and approached by the Detective.
Calmly reads to Bobby, establishing a peaceful and controlled environment despite the detective's presence nearby.
Responds correctly and willingly to the detective's inquiry, showing awareness and quick recall of why he might be sought.
Appears puzzled that anyone should know him but quickly recovers with a smile, indicating confidence and composure.
Smoothly introduces the Detective to Helen despite feeling uneasy, trying to maintain composure and a polite demeanor.
Feels uneasy in a social situation, showing some internal discomfort but attempts to mask it.
Expresses enjoyment of spending time with Bobby and Helen, engages warmly in the day's activities.
Politely defers finishing Bobby's story until tomorrow, showing consideration.
Complies quietly with the Detective's insistence to leave, without showing frustration or resistance.
Responds calmly and politely to Bobby and Helen, demonstrating social grace and emotional intelligence during a delicate interaction with humans.
Agrees to finish the story with Bobby tomorrow, showing measured restraint and patience instead of pushing for immediate attention.
Nods and complies quietly when the Detective insists on leaving with him, showing cooperation but not resistance or assertiveness.
Explains he was only trying to be helpful to a professor having difficulty with a problem.
Responds pleasantly and calmly to the Lieutenant’s sarcastic and accusatory tone.
Deceptively gives a false name and lacks identification.
Attempts to help with a difficult problem on a blackboard, shows understanding of the three-body problem.
Provides a deprecating shrug and downplays his own knowledge when questioned.
Lacks identification under false name 'Carpenter,' which raises suspicion and delays cooperation.
Expresses appallment at the news that a man was nearly killed by a mob
Pretends impatience with authorities but is actually growing concerned about the situation
Secretly amused by the Lieutenant's distrust, maintaining composure in a tense situation.
Expresses appalled reaction to mob violence and potential killing, showing awareness and moral concern.
Pretends impatience but shows growing concern about being sent to the Army, indicating thoughtful self-control and strategic communication.
Really concerned now, tries to find a way out, attempts an authoritative air to see Professor Barnhardt
Shaking off the Detective's hand and insisting on calling the Professor
Hesitates and considers making a break but allows himself to be led off when the Detective silently commands
Speaks with a polite smile of mild triumph when passing the Lieutenant, showing confidence and social skill.
Enters Barnhardt's study calmly and admits to a 'clumsy way' to introduce himself but demonstrates understanding of the situation and the person.
Points to one of the expressions in Barnhardt's equation, engaging actively and insightfully with the technical problem.
Explains complex scientific concept patiently and with a slight smile.
Shares personal details about hospital stay and nurse to build trust and connection.
Sets a firm boundary about not wasting time if he is to be turned over to the Army.
Watches Barnhardt with a faint smile.
Speaks dryly and bitterly about being denied official discussion with all nations.
Acknowledges human curiosity and requests to explain mission.
Comments on humans as a primitive society with aggressive tendencies and distrusts them with atomic power.
Expresses concern about Earth's potential for self-destruction and frames humans as children with dangerous power.
Smiles wryly when discussing past wars and learning from mistakes.
Explains that fighting leads to chaos and they learned to move beyond aggression.
Offers a solution to the danger humanity faces.
Refuses to disclose sensitive information to an individual, insisting it must be shared collectively.
Displays impatience and sternness, threatening drastic and violent action to be heard.
Agrees to meet with a diverse group of scientists and leaders to explain his mission, showing openness and trust.
Accepts Barnhardt's concerns about personal safety with calm humor and reassurance.
Threatens violent action if ignored, implying possible destruction.
Calmly proposes meeting with a group of scientists and important leaders to explain his mission, demonstrating clear purpose and strategic thinking.
Assures Barnhardt of his safety with a plausible alias and shows confidence despite potential danger.
Uses implied threats of massive destruction to demand attention, showing understanding of how to leverage power effectively.
States that Earth would have to be eliminated if proposals are rejected.
Agrees to demonstrate power in a dramatic but non-destructive way.
Easily assumes infinite power but shows willingness to avoid harm.
Steps aside politely to let Mrs. Crockett pass, shows puzzlement at nervousness around him.
Fondly and sincerely praises Bobby to Mrs. Benson, calling him warm, friendly, and intelligent.
Expresses contemplative smile and admits Bobby is his only real friend since arriving.
Steps aside calmly when Mrs. Crockett startles, showing control and composure.
Expresses awareness of others' nervousness and tries to engage sincerely, indicating emotional intelligence and social insight.
Shows slight puzzlement reading social cues (mildly uneasy Helen), which suggests some uncertainty in social navigation.
Despite his unfamiliarity, manages to build rapport with Helen and recognizes the value of his relationship with Bobby, indicating thoughtful interpersonal skills.
Speaks with easy frankness about the detective's visit and their activities with Bobby.
Responds to Tom's sarcastic comment with calm politeness and wishes both Helen and Tom a good time.
Responds to Helen's questions with easy frankness and calmness, addressing suspicions honestly without defensiveness.
Remains unperturbed and composed when Tom makes a sarcastic remark and an awkward moment arises.
Does not escalate an uncomfortable social situation, instead politely excusing himself and wishing others well.
Explains an arithmetic problem patiently to Bobby.
Responds to Helen's awkwardness with a warm smile of complete understanding and appreciation.
Explains an arithmetic problem clearly to Bobby, giving simple step-by-step guidance.
Leaves the room politely with warm understanding despite social awkwardness with Helen.
Asks Bobby for a flashlight politely and thanks him.
Lies evasively about why he needs the flashlight and acts secretively.
Requests a flashlight but lies evasively about the reason, then turns off the lights in his room and moves stealthily down the hall to avoid detection.
Moves with a determined stride showing purposeful and confident behavior.
Carefully studies the guarded building from concealed foliage, showing tactical awareness.
Waits for the patrol Jeep to leave before approaching the building, demonstrating patience and situational judgment.
Signals to Gort with flashlight to gain his attention, demonstrating a non-violent attempt at communication.
Avoids confrontation by moving carefully and seeking concealment rather than directly fighting or provoking guards.
Walks calmly toward the ship despite guards being unconscious and potential danger, showing composed and non-aggressive behavior.
Gently inquires about what Bobby told Helen, showing concern and persistence without hostility.
Maintains quiet tension and refuses to be put off despite Helen's nervous evasiveness.
Calmly persists in questioning Helen, showing patience and control despite her evasiveness
Observes Helen's nervous behavior and adjusts approach accordingly, following through tactfully when elevator crowd forms
Does not escalate confrontation despite unclear or evasive answers, demonstrating emotional intelligence and self-control
Tells Helen he should be completely honest with her before asking for her honesty
Calmly informs Helen about the global electricity neutralization to prevent panic
Does not reassure Helen directly when the elevator stops and she is terrified
Is effectively immobilized by the military in strong containment; no direct action shown in this excerpt.
Commands the group with force and authority, clearly prioritizing mission success while allowing flexibility in approach.
Explains the mission gravely and sincerely to Helen, trusting her with vital information about his life being in her hands.
Smiles warmly at Helen, establishing a friendly and trusting connection.
Calmly explains the critical importance of his mission to Helen, demonstrating awareness of the stakes and trust in her discretion.
Maintains composure and situational awareness when the elevator restarts suddenly, calmly noting the time.
Plans to keep an eye on Bobby to protect secret information and ensure safety.
Shows concern when Helen recalls Tom as another person who knows something important, indicating awareness of risk to others.
Expresses worry and concern about his companion Gort and the potential consequences if harmed.
Requests Helen to trust him with an important message to prevent harm, showing reliance and sincerity.
Puts a restraining hand on Helen's shoulder to prevent her from urging the driver on in a dangerous situation.
Gravely instructs Helen to remember important words for a serious purpose.
Attempts to leave the taxi and evade the military roadblock by making a run for the pedestrian underpass.
Looks up at Helen with a feeble smile despite being badly wounded.
Urgently insists Helen deliver a message to Gort before dying.
Attempts to escape under heavy military fire, directing Helen to deliver an urgent message to Gort before dying.
Runs for the underpass and nearly succeeds despite continuous gunfire, showing physical and mental endurance under pressure.
Unable to complete his mission personally due to being fatally wounded, relies on others to carry out critical tasks.
Instructs Helen to say a phrase that commands Gort to spare her life and protect her.
Provides Helen with a precise verbal code ('Klaatu barada nikto') that successfully commands Gort to cease aggression and assist her.
Anticipates potential danger and equips allies with a fail-safe command to control the powerful robot.
Allows Gort to rescue him from the jail cell and trusts his companion's protection.
Allows Gort to rescue and revive him after being incapacitated, demonstrating strategic trust and reliance on his robot companion.
Is incapacitated and captured in a jail cell, indicating a momentary lapse in physical control or underestimation of threats.
After being revived by Gort, Klaatu smiles gratefully and greets Helen sincerely.
Clarifies that the power of life and death belongs only to the Almighty Spirit, showing humility and respect for higher powers.
Explains the function of Gort's technique in a patient and informative way, demonstrating transparency and willingness to share knowledge.
Shrugs when asked about how long he will live, showing honesty and acceptance of uncertainty without evasion.
Steps behind a panel to change clothes with a nod of apology, indicating politeness and consideration for others.
Explains complex scientific principles clearly and calmly to Helen, demonstrating knowledge and communication skills.
Responds with honesty and realistic assessment about the uncertainty of his own lifespan, showing thoughtful awareness.
Moves decisively to change into other clothing without hesitation, indicating preparedness and purposeful action.
Expresses warm, considered admiration towards Helen; offers comfort about Bobby.
Says 'I'm sorry' in response to Helen's quiet refusal and finality.
Prepares to leave despite emotional ties, showing acceptance without bitterness.
Moves calmly and confidently, shows warmth and considered admiration, operates the ship's controls to reveal the outside meeting
Does not directly intervene or assert dominance when tensions might be high, but instead uses a controlled and deliberate approach
Shows empathy and emotional warmth in interactions with Helen, balancing emotional intelligence with purposeful actions
Shares the bitterness of the others' disappointment about not meeting, showing empathy.
Cuts off the communication from the meeting abruptly by flipping off the switch.
Commands Gort with a single word and does not intervene when the crowd is full of terror at Gort's appearance.
Flips off the speaker switch promptly to cut off the broadcast and speaks a clear command to Gort who obeys immediately.
Does not intervene or attempt to calm or address the crowd or meeting directly before Barnhardt suggests leaving, instead letting events unfold passively.
Speaks bluntly with stern authority urging universal security and elimination of aggression for mutual protection.
Stares with defiance at armed soldiers, holding them off by sheer weight of personality rather than aggression.
Explains the peaceful system with candor and straightforwardness, emphasizing security without arms or armies.
Issues a stark warning that Earth will be obliterated if it continues violence.
Presents a clear choice for peace or destruction without emotional manipulation.
Nods and smiles at Barnhardt and Helen with warm affection while saying goodbye.
Commands Gort efficiently with a single word ('veracto'), prompting an immediate and precise action to remove the building roof and walls cleanly and safely.
Demonstrates calm and warm affection when bidding farewell to Barnhardt and Helen, showing emotional intelligence alongside leadership.
Disappears quietly into the ship and departs smoothly after completing his mission, indicating confidence and effective execution.
Arrives calmly and with dignity, displaying a confident and commanding presence before a tense and hostile crowd.
Uses a universal gesture of neutrality before speaking clearly in perfect English, signaling diplomatic skill and awareness of first impressions.
Advances slowly toward armed soldiers holding a mysterious, ambiguous object in a manner intended as offering but that could be misinterpreted as threatening.
Approaches the platoon leader raising an object to communicate intentions clearly despite tense situation.
Fails to anticipate that his gesture would be misinterpreted as threatening, resulting in being shot and wounded.
Maintains a calm, authoritative demeanor even while injured, projecting dignity and assurance.
Studies Harley silently with cool, penetrating, reserved eyes, demonstrating careful observation and control.
Commands Harley to sit down, asserting control of the situation with even, calm speech.
Responds to questions clearly and confidently, provides precise information (travel time, distance).
Uses diplomatic, easy language to explain complex, extraordinary concepts ('neighbors' from another planet).
Allows Harley to smile and fish for information before carefully guiding the conversation with measured words.
Responds politely and gratefully to Harley's greeting, showing consideration for others.
Ignores the sheaf of cables with important diplomatic replies, showing detachment or possible disregard for others' perspectives.
Suggests spending the day with Bobby to Helen, showing confidence and ease in social interaction.
Engages Bobby in meaningful conversation and listening, demonstrating thoughtful companionship.
Offers to ask Bobby how he feels about the plan, showing considerate and skillful social behavior.
Reads the Gettysburg Address and comments with genuine respect and thoughtful insight, displaying intelligence and cultural awareness.
Carefully examines complex scientific equations on a blackboard, showing interest and curiosity.
Follows Bobby's lead in approaching the house and ringing the doorbell without immediate alternative action when no one answers.
Uses a flashlight to send an intermittent signal to Gort, eliciting a deliberate response from the robot.
Maneuvers stealthily around the building, avoiding detection by guards.
Waits patiently and observes guards' positions before acting, demonstrating tactical patience.
Remains calm and composed during the elevator power failure, assesses the situation, and informs Helen about the nature of the global electricity neutralization.
Hesitates momentarily when asked what time it is, showing a brief lapse before recalling the time.
Causes the entire city to stop simultaneously, demonstrating a clever and impactful strategy.
Does not appear directly in the excerpt or take any visible action himself.
Hurries down the steps and quickly gets into a waiting taxi to leave the boardinghouse street, demonstrating prompt decision-making and awareness of the situation.
Commands a powerful robot (Gort) capable of neutralizing threats without explicit aggression.
Relies on Gort's intimidating presence to manage tense situations calmly and effectively.
Does not personally intervene in a potentially dangerous situation, delegating threat neutralization to Gort.
